page.title: 19LANDSCAPE.
page.content: From wherever you stand in the villages you notice how flat the land is and how the roads have been raised on banks to stand some three or four metres above it.The land is disected by dykes.There is very little woodland but the major kind of tree is Oak.The fields are large and the majority still have hedges to mark their boundary.The fields contain much natural wildlife and the poacher is a person who still exists today.The landscape is spoilt by an electricity sub_station which stands on the outskirts of Walpole St.Peter and is visible for a number of miles.The outstanding feature however as one travels towards the villages is in the church tower of Walpole St.Peter church and the trees that surround it and the rectory.
